zone.line: I, child of Deity, that myself already
Quite near think of the mirror eternal reality,
Thyself enough in the light of Heaven, & serenity,
And divided from the Sons of Earth.
I, more like a Cherub, free power
Already thro' the viens of Nature to bend,
And, providing, the life of Gods to enjoy
Thyself full of forebodings measure, how must I ?repair
A thunder-sentence has borne me away —
Not dare I to thee liken myself rash.
Have I the power thee to draw away ( )
As had I thee to stop noo power.
I feel myself so small, so great,
On the unintelligible destiny of Man.
Who tho taught me, what shall I avoid
Shall I hearken to this throng?
